Semester 1: State Core Gen Ed Composition (Writing Requirement) (3 credits)
State Core Gen Ed Social and Behavioral Sciences (3 credits)
Semester 2: State Core Gen Ed Biological or Physical Sciences (3 credits)
State Core Gen Ed Mathematics (pure math) (3 credits)
Science laboratory (Gen Ed Biological or Physical Sciences) (1 credits)
Elective (needed if placed out of language with SAT II) (3 credits)
Semester 3: Quest 2 Gen Ed Biological or Physical Sciences (area not taken in semester two) (3 credits)
Sociology course (Critical Tracking; Gen Ed Social and Behavioral Sciences; 2000 level or above) (CT) (3 credits)
State Core Gen Ed Humanities (3 credits)
Elective (or foreign language, if 4-3-3 option) (3 credits)
Semester 5: Elective (3000 level or above, not in major) (3 credits)
Semester 6: Sociology course (Critical Tracking; 2000 level or above) (CT) (3 credits)
Elective (3000 level or above, not in major) (3 credits)
Semester 7: Electives (3000 level or above, not in major) (6 credits)
Semester 8: Two Sociology courses (Critical Tracking; 3000/4000 level) (CT) (6 credits)
Electives (3000 level or above, not in major) (6 credits)
